title: Generalized ELBO with Constrained Optimization , GECO
abstract: Deep variational auto-encoders (VAEs) are latent-variable generative models that define a joint density p(x, z) between some observed data x ∈ Rx and unobserved or latent variables z ∈ Rz . The most popular method for training these models is through stochastic amortized variational approximations [1, 2], which use a variational posterior (also referred to as encoder), q(z|x), to construct the evidence lower-bound (ELBO) objective function.

tldr.text: Deep variational auto-encoders are latent-variable generative models that define a joint density p(x, z) between some observed data x ∈ Rx and unobserved or latent variables z ∈ Rz.
